com.wit.and.widget.adapter.module

Interface SelectionModule.SelectableItemsAdapter<Item extends SelectableItem>

  • Type Parameters:
    Item - The select-able item type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AdapterModule.ModuleAdapter
    Enclosing class:
    SelectionModule<Item extends SelectableItem,Adapter extends SelectionModule.SelectableItemsAdapter<Item>>

    public static interface SelectionModule.SelectableItemsAdapter<Item extends SelectableItem>
extends AdapterModule.ModuleAdapter

    Interface Overview

    Base required interface for adapter with selectable items which is using the SelectionModule to provide management with its selectable items.

    Note that the getSelectableItem(int) method doesn't require to be implemented to be selection module functional, because with or without this implementation will be items selected according to theirs position in the adapter. So if you have for example implementation of BaseCursorAdapter, than you have all your items provided by that adapter stored in Cursor which can't extends SelectableItem so you just return in the hasSelectableItems() method false and you can check for selected item by calling SelectionModule.isSelected(int) method on your selection module of that adapter.

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    SelectableItem, SelectionModule

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Item getSelectableItem(int position)
      Returns selectable item for the requested position.
      boolean hasSelectableItems()
      Returns flag indicating, whether adapter has selectable items presented (accessible by getSelectableItem(int)) or not.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.wit.and.widget.adapter.module.AdapterModule.ModuleAdapter

        getCount, notifyDataSetChanged

    • Method Detail

      • getSelectableItem

        Item getSelectableItem(int position)

        Returns selectable item for the requested position.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the select-able item in the adapter.
        Returns:
        Selectable item from adapter, or null if the given position is out of items range or adapter doesn't have any selectable items presented.
        See Also:
        hasSelectableItems()

      • hasSelectableItems

        boolean hasSelectableItems()

        Returns flag indicating, whether adapter has selectable items presented (accessible by getSelectableItem(int)) or not.

        Returns:
        True if adapter has selectable items presented, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getSelectableItem(int)
